result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Brian Matthew Henke was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

Fine and costs shall be paid at the rate of $25/month commencing August 1, 2022 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian Matthew Henke in court.  Attorney Chad M Fahrenkrug in court for Brian Matthew Henke. Court reviews amended complaint and finds probable cause; NG pleas entered. Def wishes to proceed to plea and sentencing.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2; Court so orders. Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1.  Def acknowledges prior OWI conviction.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1.  Argument from State and counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Def to file petition for 1/2 price IID if he so desires.

Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian Matthew Henke in court.  Attorney Chad M Fahrenkrug in court for Brian Matthew Henke. Counsel's first appearance. Blood results have not been rec'd.

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian Matthew Henke in court. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def referred to SPD (slip provided).  Court sets $500 signature bond.  Court enters NG plea on behalf of def.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.
